content: the remaining 32 stitches on a spare needle and work the heel back and forth on the 32 stitches you have just worked as follows row 1 sl1 *k1 sl1 repeat from * to last st k1 turn row 2 sl1 purl to end of row turn row 3 sl1 *sl1 k1 repeat from * to last st k1 turn row 4 as row 2 repeat these 4 row 7 more times for a total of 8 pattern repeats turn heel row 1 k19 ssk k1 turn row 2 sl1 p7 p2tog p1 turn row 3 sl1 k8 ssk k1 turn row 4 sl1 purl to 1 stitch before gap created by ssk on previous row p2tog p1 turn row 5 sl1 knit to 1 stitch before gap created by p2tog on previous row ssk k1 turn repeat last two row row 4 & 5 until all stitches have been worked ending with a row 4 purl you should have 20 heel stitches gusset knit across the 20 heel stitches page 4 of 6 sarah youde / a dorky emu let it shine socks - ver 1 0 pick up and knit 17 stitches down the side of the heel onto current needle knit across 32 instep stitches maintaining pattern pick up and knit 17 stitches down the side of the heel flap then knit across 10 heel stitches place a marker for the beginning of the round at this stage i like to split my stitches on a circular needle so that the first needle holds the 10 heel stitches remaining after the stitch marker the 17 gusset stitches on that side of the sock and 16 of the instep stitches the second needle holds the rest of the stitches when i am using double pointed needles i have three with stitches on and use the fourth for knitting in this case the stitches would be distributed as follows needle 1 10 remaining heel stitches and the 17 gusset stitches needle 2 32 instep stitches needle 3 17 gusset stitches and the other 10 heel stitches gusset decreases setup row k25 k2tog pm k32 instep stitches maintaining pattern as set pm k2tog k25 row 1 knit to 3 stitches before marker k2tog k1 sm work instep stitches in pattern as set sm k1 ssk knit to end row 2 knit all stitches maintaining pattern over the instep stitches repeat the last 2 row until 64 stitches remain page 5 of 6 sarah youde / a dorky emu let it shine socks - ver 1 0 at this stage i re-arrange my stitches so that the sole stitches are on one side of my knitting and the instep stitches are on the other i change the start of the round to be at the beginning of the instep stitches by placing a marker there all other markers can be removed during the next round of knitting foot continue in pattern as set across the instep stitches and work the sole
